 links.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=311320802; y=QFG9Kh2If7kiIrpzG036xlYWfufr9nsDYy8nKLz7P6AZwWXBi1ELE5MuRQ

--------------090601070008040206090801
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

The order doesn't really matter. If you are activating the NN every time 
step, the output might be 0 for the first 1-3 steps only, but that 
shouldn't be a problem. If you are activating the NN a fixed number of 
times for the XOR problem, it still doesn't matter because after 4 
activations or so the information from the inputs should have reached 
the output regardless of the order.

Peter

On 08/04/2015 05:57 AM, bbjprizes@... [neat] wrote:
>
> Thank you both for your input.  Right now I'm just trying to get the 
> XOR experiment working. One of the problems I'm trying to overcome is 
> the execution order of the neurons when I generate the network. Quick 
> example. Node 1 is an input and node 2 is the output, so gene 1 is 
> from 1->2.  But if a hidden nodes get added, node 3, which is between 
> 1 and 2 the genes are now 1->3 and 3->2 but when I generate my network 
> neuron 1 has a link from 3->2  ( at which point neuron 2 has not been 
> calculated).
>
>
> Do the neurons need to be sorted?  Again most of the examples I've 
> found loop through the neurons and sum the inputs, but that would 
> again assume the neurons are in the correct order.
>
> Thanks again.
> 


--------------090601070008040206090801
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

<html>
  <head>
    <meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="Content-Type">

  <body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" text="#000000">
    <div class="moz-cite-prefix">The order doesn't really matter. If you
      are activating the NN every time step, the output might be 0 for
      the first 1-3 steps only, but that shouldn't be a problem. If you
      are activating the NN a fixed number of times for the XOR problem,
      it still doesn't matter because after 4 activations or so the
      information from the inputs should have reached the output
      regardless of the order. <br>
      <br>
      Peter<br>
      <br>
      On 08/04/2015 05:57 AM, <a class="moz-txt-link-abbreviated" href="mailto:bbjprizes@...">bbjprizes@...</a> [neat] wrote:<br>
    </div>
    <blockquote cite="mid:mpp9n2+198oqe9@..." type="cite"> <span
        style="display:none"> </span>
      
          <div id="ygrp-text">
            <p>Thank you both for your input.  Right now I'm just trying
              to get the XOR experiment working. One of the problems I'm
              trying to overcome is the execution order of the neurons
              when I generate the network. Quick example. Node 1 is an
              input and node 2 is the output, so gene 1 is from 1->2.
               But if a hidden nodes get added, node 3, which is between
              1 and 2 the genes are now 1->3 and 3->2 but when I
              generate my network neuron 1 has a link from 3->2  ( at
              which point neuron 2 has not been calculated).</p>
            <div><br>
            </div>
            <div>Do the neurons need to be sorted?  Again most of the
              examples I've found loop through the neurons and sum the
              inputs, but that would again assume the neurons are in the
              correct order.</div>
            <div><br>
            </div>
            <div>Thanks again.</div>
          </div>
          
      
      <!-- end group email -->
    </blockquote>
    <br>
  </body>
</html>
